input: Write a short biography of Julius Caesar.

input: Write a short biography of Cleopatra.

The couple ruled jointly, and when Antony died in 30 BCE, she returned to Rome and married her young son with Antony to Octavian's sister Octavia. When Cleopatra committed suicide by snakebite in 30 BCE, Octavian installed Ptolemy XIV sole ruler of Egypt.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Luxemburg.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Luxemburg.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Luxemburg.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Luxemburg.
output: Rosa Luxemburg (1870-1919) was a German philosopher and Marxist theorist. A leader of the Communist Party of Germany, she criticized Lenin's Bolshevik regime in Russia. Luxemburg led the Spartacist uprising in Germany in January 1919, an unsuccessful coup attempt to overthrow the provisional government headed by Friedrich Ebert. She was arrested and imprisoned, but the plot inspired the formation of the German Communist party. Rosa Luxemburg was brutally tortured and murdered on January 15, 1919.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Luxemburg.
output: Rosa Luxemburg (1870-1919) was a Polish-born revolutionary socialist and political theorist. In her early years, she studied philosophy and economics in university while learning Marxism. With others, Luxemburg founded the socialist Spartacus League in 1915 that would merge into the Communist Party. Alongside Karl Liebknecht, she co-founded the German Communist Party in 1918. When war broke out Luxemburg argued against any peace agreements that would preserve capitalist property relations. She was arrested and imprisoned until released at the end of the war. Luxemburg, a pacifist, opposed a socialist dictatorship and fought for universal suffrage. She was targeted by the Spartacist League and killed in 1919.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Luxemburg.
output: Rosa Luxemburg (born 1870 - 1919) was a German revolutionary who helped build Communist Party of Germany and the Spartacist League. She was an influential social theorist who called for a “mass movement” of the working class in order to topple capitalism. Luxemburg was executed after leading an armed Communist uprising against the German government in 1919. She is considered a hero of the German working class and prominent 20th-century socialists.

input: Write a short biography of Bob Marley.
output: Bob Marley (born 1945) was a Jamaican reggae singer who launched the careers of prominent reggae artists. Known as "The King of Reggae," his work with The Wailers, which included Peter Tosh and Bunny Wailer, was heavily influenced by gospel, R&B, ska, and rock. After The Wailers' breakup, Marley established his own solo career. Along with songs like "Easy Skanking" and "Simmer Down," he's popularly known for songs like "No Woman, No Cry," "Buffalo Soldiér," and "I Shot the Sheriff." Marley's songs explored themes like love, warfare, poverty, racism, and religious beliefs. He passed away in 1981 at the age of 36.

output: Robert Nesta Marley (1945-1981) was a Jamaican singer, songwriter, musician, and political activist who rose to become one of the best-known artists from the Caribbean. He formed the band Bob Marley & the Wailers, renowned for their blend of reggae, ska, and rock music. While touring, Marley contracted a malignant cancer, but continued performing and recording until his death, at age 36. His work reached a broad cross-section of the world community, inspiring generations with songs about political, racial, and spiritual issues. His 1977 song was inspired by the assassination of Jamaican reggae singer Peter Tosh.

output: Bob Marley (1945-1981) was a singer and songwriter of reggae music and cultural icon of popular music. He played an influential role in the Rastafarian movement and his distinct vocal style earned him the nickname "the voice of reggae." Marley was discovered in Jamaica by guitarist Peter Tosh, who introduced him to Island Records executive Chris Blackwell. Marley released his first international record "Stir It Up" in 1972 and quickly became a chart-topping success. He embraced political and social activism and, with the Wailers, helped broaden reggae's appeal to mainstream audiences in the UK and US. Marley died of cancer in 1981. After his death, his music became widely popular globally, and he remained an enduring cultural icon.

input: Write a short biography of Bob Marley.
output: Robert "Bob" Nesta Marley (1945-1981) was a Jamaican musician, singer, and songwriter, and a central figure in the history and culture of reggae. Born to a black father and a white mother, Marley faced prejudice in a deeply segregated Jamaica. Marley learned to play the guitar and piano while working on a plantation. He founded the band the Wailers in 1963, recording their first hit "Small Axe" in 1964. Marley's hits include "One Love," "No Woman No Cry," and "Three Little Birds." Marley died in 1981 of brain cancer. In his obituary, Time Magazine chose him as "The First Black Hero of Postwar America."

input: Write a short biography of Bob Marley.
output: Robert Nesta "Bob" Marley (1945-1981) was a Jamaican reggae singer and songwriter who popularized the genre. Born to poor farming parents in Kingston, Marley began singing with friends and recorded his first single on an acetate record. The Wailers was formed in 1973 with Peter Tosh and Bunny Wailer and released the legendary "Rasta Revolution" album. Marley's second solo album, titled "Catch a Fire," became world famous, kickstarting his global fame. In the '70s, Marley's music criticized the harsh social conditions of Jamaica including poverty and racial tensions. Marley died of cancer in April 1981, but his legacy continues to inspire social justice movements around the world.

input: Write a short biography of Bob Marley.
output: Bob Marley (1945-1981) was an influential reggae singer. Raised in Nine Mile, Jamaica, Marley formed Bob Marley and the Wailers in 1963, and they released the album "Catch a Fire" in 1973.
